intro: Acianthera neibana, commonly known as the Neibana's orchid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and green. Acianthera neibana thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing in cloud forests or under the canopy of tall trees. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
